author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(tree_conflict_on_add): Do not ever try to add new tree conflicts
before removing existing ones. The old logic would try to do this
in some cases since it did not consider the "existing_conflict != NULL"
case in isolation. This might fix issue #3495, I can't verify this
myself since I cannot reproduce the issue.
(merge_file_added): If there are no obstructions or missing nodes,
but there is no node on disk, only add the new file if no tree
conflict has been flagged at this path yet. Otherwise, branch out
to tree_conflict_on_add().
If there are no obstructions or missing nodes, and a file is already
present on disk, flag a tree conflict as before, but do not consider
the existing file's schedule as an indicator for the tree conflict
reason. Rather, just flag the conflict with reason "added", based
on the assumption that an add must have happened in the history of
the branch.

author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/dso.c
(svn_dso_initialize2): Wrap declaration of 'status' variable in
#if APR_HAS_THREADS, as all code that uses it is also wrapped in it.
Avoids 'unused variable' warning during compilation with non-threaded APR.

author: hwright
msg: Remove the wc_db member from the pdh struct.  It was put there for potential
future use, but it appears that that future will never materialize.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c
(svn_wc__db_pdh_t): Remove db member.
(get_or_create_pdh, parse_local_abspath): Don't set or test the pdh db
member.
(navigate_to_parent): Explicitly provide a db parameter, instead of relying
on one in the child_pdh.
(svn_wc__db_temp_op_remove_entry, svn_wc__db_temp_op_set_dir_depth,
svn_wc__db_scane_addition, svn_wc__db_scan_deletion):
Update callers to the above.

author: rhuijben
msg: Rename name argument of write_entry() to local_relpath, as that is
what the value is used for.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c
(write_entry): Rename 'name' argument to local_relpath, and calculate
parent_relpath instead of making a shortcut.

author: julianfoad
msg: Fix issue #2713, "add --auto-props, adds file with mixed eol then aborts".
When adding a file with mixed EOL style, with auto-props setting svn:eol-style,
svn treats this as an error and aborts. Previously, it marked the file for
addition and applied an indeterminate subset of the auto-props before aborting.
Instead, if any auto-prop setting fails, abort without marking the file for
addition.
* subversion/libsvn_client/add.c
(add_file): If we fail to set a property on the added file, revert the add.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/autoprop_tests.py
(fail_add_mixed_eol_style): New test.
(test_list): Add the new test.
